title: 113_hr789
content: The "Build America Bonds Act of 2013" makes Build America Bonds permanent. The Build America Bonds Act of 2013 makes Build America Bonds permanent and amends the Internal Revenue Code regarding the credit percentage to bondholders. The applicable percentage for bonds issued during different calendar years ranges from 35% in 2009 or 2010 to 28% in 2017 and thereafter. The Build America Bonds Act of 2013 extends payments to issuers. The Build America Bonds Act of 2013 extends payments to issuers for certain qualified bonds issued during a particular period. Amendments include changes to subsection (g) of section 54AA and subsection (b) of section 6431 of the Internal Revenue Code. The Secretary amends subsection (g) of section 54AA by replacing "35 percent" with "the applicable percentage" and defines the term "applicable percentage" in a table. The applicable percentage for qualified bonds issued during specific calendar years ranges from 35% in 2009 or 2010 to 28% in 2017 and thereafter. Current refunding bonds are permitted under subsection (g) of section 54AA of the Code. The applicable percentage for refunding bonds is determined based on specific calendar years, ranging from 35% in 2009 or 2010 to 28% in 2017 and beyond. Refunding bonds must meet certain criteria, including having an average maturity date not later than the bonds being refunded and being redeemed within 90 days of issuance. The lowest percentage for refunding bonds is determined based on specific calendar years. Average maturity is determined according to section 147(b)(2)(A). Issuance restriction does not apply to refunding bonds. Clarification is made regarding levees and flood control projects. A gross-up of payment to issuers in case of sequestration is addressed. The Code of 1986 addresses sequestration of payments, increasing them based on specific calculations. Sequestration refers to spending reductions ordered by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. The amendments made by this section apply to obligations issued after the enactment of the Act.
